Title: CASE OF MALAGIĆ v. CROATIA
Conclusion(s): No violation of Article 8 - Right to respect for private and family life (Article 8 - Positive obligations Article 8-1 - Respect for private life)
Domestic Law: Article 139 of the Criminal Code 2011 (Official Gazette nos. 15/11 with subsequent amendments)
Code of Criminal Procedure (Official Gazette nos. 152/08 with subsequent amendments)
Protection against Domestic Violence Act (Official Gazette nos. 137/2009 with subsequent amendments)
Strasbourg Case-Law: B. v. the Republic of Moldova, no. 61382/09, §§ 71 and 73, 16 July 2013
Bălşan v. Romania, no. 49645/09, §§ 57 and 67, 23 May 2017
Bevacqua and S. v. Bulgaria, no. 71127/01, § 79, 12 June 2008
N.P. and N.I. v. Bulgaria (dec.), no. 72226/11, § 87, 3 May 2016
Radomilja and Others v. Croatia [GC], nos. 37685/10 and 22768/12, § 114, 20 March 2018
Sandra Janković v. Croatia, no. 38478/05, § 46, 5 March 2009
X and Others v. Bulgaria [GC], no. 22457/16, § 178, 2 February 2021
International Law: Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council (2012/29/EU) of 25 October 2012 establishing minimum standards on the rights, support and protection of victims of crime
Council of Europe Convention on Preventing and Combating Violence against Women and Domestic Violence
Keywords: (Art. 8) Right to respect for private and family life
